00043 static void correct_quotes(string&, string::size_type&);

00048 int on_off = 1;

00052 
00053 int PciIdsVendor::store_db()
00054 {
00055   std::vector<PciIdsDevice*>::iterator iter_dev;
00056   std::vector<PciIdsSubsys*>::iterator iter_subsys;
00057 
00058   PciIdsDevice* tmp_dev;
00059   PciIdsSubsys* tmp_subsys;
00060 
00061   const string host_url("localhost");                       // Where MySQL Server is located.
00062   const string user("root");                                // User to connect to the server.
00063   const string pass("password");                            // Password of the user.
00064   const string database("harix_db");                        // Database to connect to.
00065 
00066   // Hold names and codes of the Pci IDs device entries.
00067   string vendor_code, vendor_name, device_code, device_name, subsys_vdr, subsys_dev, subsys_name, tmp_name;
00068   
00069   const string quote = "\"";
00070   string::size_type qpos;
00071 
00072   // Could be better with MySQL Prepared Statement
00073   // but it's buggy operating with Stored Procedures at the moment
00074   
00075   try{
00076     
00077     /*
00078      * Connect to Database with MySQL Connector/C++
00079      * @{
00080      */
00081     sql::Driver* driver = get_driver_instance();
00082     std::auto_ptr<sql::Connection> connector( driver->connect(host_url, user, pass) );
00083 #ifdef DEBUG
00084     connector->setClientOption("clientTrace", &on_off);
00085 #endif
00086     connector->setSchema(database);
00087     std::auto_ptr<sql::Statement> stmt(connector->createStatement());
00088     /*
00089      * @}
00090      */
00091 
00092     vendor_code = "\"" + get_code() + "\"" ;    // Get code of current Pci IDs vendor object.
00093     
00094     tmp_name = get_name();                      // Get name of current Pci IDs vendor object,
00095     qpos = tmp_name.find(quote);                // see if it has qoutes(") inside,
00096     if ( qpos != string::npos )                 // which will cause a problem in SQL statement,
00097       correct_quotes(tmp_name,qpos);            // so correct qoutes to (\").
00098 
00099     vendor_name = "\"" + tmp_name + "\"";
00100     
00101     // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given vendor.
00102     stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_VendorsAdd("+ vendor_code + "," + vendor_name + ")");
00103 
00104     // Empty the retrieved result set, so we don't have problems with next statement.
00105     throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00106 
00107     
00108     if ( kid_list.size() == 0 ){                    // If the current Pci IDs vendor has no device entry,
00109 
00110       device_code = "\"XXXX\"";                     // set the device code as "XXXX" and
00111       device_name = "null";                         // put an entry in `pci_device'.
00112       stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_DevicesAdd("+ vendor_code + "," + device_code + "," + device_name + ")");
00113       throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00114 
00115       subsys_vdr =  "null" ;                        // And for the currently stored device,
00116       subsys_dev =  "null" ;                        // put an entry in `pci_subsystems'
00117       subsys_name =  "null" ;                       // with subvendor, subdevice, subSysName values being null.
00118       stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_SubsystemsAdd("
00119                     + vendor_code + "," + device_code + ","
00120                     + subsys_vdr + "," + subsys_dev + "," + subsys_name + ")");
00121       throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00122 
00123     }
00124     else {                                          // When the current Pci IDs vendor has device entries
00125 
00126       // loop through the device list of vendor
00127       for( iter_dev = kid_list.begin(); iter_dev != kid_list.end(); ++iter_dev ){
00128         
00129         tmp_dev = *iter_dev;
00130         device_code = "\"" + tmp_dev->get_code() + "\"" ; // Get code of current Pci IDs device object.
00131         tmp_name = tmp_dev->get_name();                 // And get name of current Pci IDs device object,
00132         qpos = tmp_name.find(quote);                    // correcting qoutes.
00133         if ( qpos != string::npos )
00134           correct_quotes(tmp_name,qpos);
00135 
00136         device_name = "\"" + tmp_name + "\"";
00137         
00138         // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given device of the vendor.
00139         stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_DevicesAdd("+ vendor_code + "," + device_code + "," + device_name + ")");
00140         throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00141         
00142 
00143         if( (tmp_dev->subsystem_list).size() == 0  ){       // If current Pci IDs device has no subsystem entry,
00144           
00145           subsys_vdr =  "null" ;                            // for the currently stored device,
00146           subsys_dev =  "null" ;                            // put an entry in `pci_subsystems' with
00147           subsys_name =  "null" ;                           // subvendor, subdevice, subSysName values being null.
00148           stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_SubsystemsAdd("
00149                         + vendor_code + "," + device_code + ","
00150                         + subsys_vdr + "," + subsys_dev + "," + subsys_name + ")");
00151           throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00152 
00153           continue;                                         // Continue to look for other devices of the vendor.
00154           
00155         }
00156 
00157         // When the current Pci IDs device, has subsystem entries,
00158         // iterate through the subsystem list of the device
00159         for( iter_subsys = (tmp_dev->subsystem_list).begin(); iter_subsys != (tmp_dev->subsystem_list).end();
00160              ++iter_subsys ){
00161           
00162           tmp_subsys = *iter_subsys;
00163           subsys_vdr =  "\"" + tmp_subsys->get_subVendor() + "\"" ; // Get subvendor of Pci IDs subsystem object.
00164           subsys_dev =  "\"" + tmp_subsys->get_subDevice() + "\"" ; // Get subdevice of Pci IDs subsystem object.
00165           tmp_name = tmp_subsys->get_name();                    // Get subsystem name of Pci IDs subsystem object,
00166           qpos = tmp_name.find(quote);                          // correcting qoutes.
00167           if ( qpos != string::npos )
00168             correct_quotes(tmp_name,qpos);
00169 
00170           subsys_name =  "\"" + tmp_name + "\"" ;
00171 
00172           // Call the stored procedure to add or update the given subsystem of the device.
00173           stmt->execute("CALL sp_pci_SubsystemsAdd("
00174                         + vendor_code + "," + device_code + ","
00175                         + subsys_vdr + "," + subsys_dev + "," + subsys_name + ")");
00176           throw_call_garbage(stmt.get());
00177 
00178         }
00179       }
00180     }
00181   }
00182   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00183     /*
00184       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00185       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00186       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00187       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00188     */
00189     std::cout << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00190     std::cout << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__ << std::endl;
00191     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00192     std::cout << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00193     std::cout << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00194     std::cout << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )" << std::endl;
00195     return 1;
00196 
00197   }
00198 
00199   return 0;
00200 }

00205 
00212 static void correct_quotes(string& tmp_str, string::size_type& qpos)
00213 {
00214   const string quote = "\"";
00215   do{
00216     tmp_str.replace(qpos, quote.size(), "\\\"" );   // Replace to quote
00217     qpos = tmp_str.find(quote, qpos+2);             // Find the next occurence
00218   }while(qpos != string::npos);                     // until the end of string
00219 }
00220

00222 
00224 
00230 static void throw_call_garbage(sql::Statement* normal_stmt)
00231 {
00232   std::auto_ptr< sql::ResultSet > res;
00233   do {
00234     res.reset(normal_stmt->getResultSet());     // Get result set of the statement,
00235     while (res->next()) {                       // and process until there are no more values left.
00236 #ifdef DEBUG
00237       std::cout << res->getInt(1) << " -> expected value is 0" << std::endl;
00238 #endif
00239     }
00240   } while (normal_stmt->getMoreResults());      // continue if more ResultSets exists, which is not really likely
00241 }

00245 
00246 PciIdsVendor::~PciIdsVendor()
00247 {
00248   int device_list_size = kid_list.size();
00249   
00250   // Loop through the Devices(kid_list) of current Vendor and delete them.
00251   for ( int k=0; k < device_list_size; k++ ){
00252     
00253     delete kid_list.back();     // Since we store pointers in kid_list,
00254                                 // at first we delete the data pointed by the pointer.
00255     
00256     kid_list.pop_back();        // Then we remove the pointer from kid_list.
00257   }
00258 
00259 }
00260 
00261 
00262 
00263 PciIdsDevice::~PciIdsDevice()
00264 {
00265   int subsystem_list_size = subsystem_list.size();
00266 
00267   // Loop through the Subsystems(subsystem_list) of current Device and delete them. 
00268   for (int k=0; k < subsystem_list_size; k++){
00269     
00270     delete subsystem_list.back();   // Since we store pointers in subsystem_list,
00271                                     // at first we delete the data pointed by the pointer.
00272     
00273     subsystem_list.pop_back();      // Then we remove the pointer from subsystem_list.
00274     
00275   }
00276 }
